              Amazon is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. We are driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that change lives. We embrace new ways of doing things, make decisions quickly, and are not afraid to fail. We have the scope and capabilities of a large company, and the spirit and heart of a small one.

Together, Amazonians research and develop new technologies from Amazon Web Services to Alexa on behalf of our customers: shoppers, sellers, content creators, and developers around the world.

Our mission is to be Earth's most customer-centric company. Our actions, goals, projects, programs, and inventions begin and end with the customer top of mind.

You'll also hear us say that at Amazon, it's always "Day 1." What do we mean? That our approach remains the same as it was on Amazon's very first day - to make smart, fast decisions, stay nimble, invent, and focus on delighting our customers.

But there's been one huge obstacle: quantum systems are incredibly fragile and prone to errors. 

Today marks a breakthrough. We just unveiled Ocelot, Amazon Web Services (AWS)'s new quantum chip that takes a completely different approach to this challenge. 

Our team used a novel design for Ocelot's architecture, building error correction in from the ground up, leveraging special quantum bits (called 'cat qubits'). They naturally resist errors, much like building immunity into the system itself rather than trying to fix errors after they happen.

We're the first to successfully put this technology into an integrated microchip that can be manufactured using fabrication processes adopted from the microelectronics industry. That means we‚Äôve reduced the resources needed for error correction by as much as 90%, accelerating our path to practical quantum computing by an estimated 5 years. 

Think of this like going from unreliable vacuum tubes to dependable transistors in early computing‚Äîa fundamental shift that turned possibilities into reality. From discovering new medicines faster, to developing better clean energy solutions, we're accelerating the path to real-world quantum computing. 

While there's still a lot more work ahead here, I'm super proud of the team's achievement. Check out this peek into our quantum lab where they've been working on Ocelot, and stay tuned for more!

              The first business of Alibaba Group, Alibaba.com (www.alibaba.com) is the leading platform for global wholesale trade serving millions of buyers and suppliers around the world. Through Alibaba.com, small businesses can sell their products to companies in other countries. Sellers on Alibaba.com are typically manufacturers and distributors based in China and other manufacturing countries such as India, Pakistan, the United States and Thailand.

Our Mission
As part of the Alibaba Group, our mission is to make it easy to do business anywhere.  We do this by giving suppliers the tools necessary to reach a global audience for their products, and by helping buyers find products and suppliers quickly and efficiently.

One-Stop Sourcing
Alibaba.com brings you hundreds of millions of products in over 40 different major categories, including consumer electronics, machinery and apparel.
Buyers for these products are located in 190+ countries and regions, and exchange hundreds of thousands of messages with suppliers on the platform each day.

Anytime, Anywhere
As a platform, we continue to develop services to help businesses do more and discover new opportunities. 
Whether it‚Äôs sourcing from your mobile phone or contacting suppliers in their local language, turn to Alibaba.com for all your global business needs.

At Alibaba.com, we take pride in supporting businesses like NODNAL Co. a family-owned brand dedicated to providing premium, ethically designed baby essentials. From ultra-soft sheets to cozy blankets, NODNAL Co has built a brand that parents trust‚Äîwithout compromising on sustainability.

As they continue to grow in 2025, their mission is clear:
 ‚ú® Expand their product line with new, innovative baby essentials

              Welcome to Zalando. Here‚Äôs some key info about us:

Our position and vision:
- We‚Äôre Europe‚Äôs leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle.
- Founded in Berlin in 2008, we bring head-to-toe fashion to more than 50 million active customers in 25 markets; offering clothes, footwear, accessories, and beauty. 
- We're building the ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle ecommerce.

Our offering:
- Our assortment of international brands ranges from world-famous names to local labels
- Our platform is a one-stop fashion destination for inspiration, innovation, and interaction
- As Europe‚Äôs most fashionable tech company, we work hard to find digital solutions for every aspect of the fashion journey: for our customers, partners, and friends of our brand.
- Our logistics network with 12 centrally located fulfillment centers allows us to efficiently serve our customers throughout Europe, supported by warehouses in Italy, France, Poland, and Sweden with a focus on local customer needs. 

Our beliefs:
- Our ambition is to combine our passion for self-expression through fashion with our unwavering commitments to sustainability and D&I
- We believe that our integration of fashion, operations, and online technology gives us the capability to deliver a compelling value proposition to both our customers and fashion brand partners.

Moderated by Ramilya Krawinkel (VP Partner Platform), we heard from our leaders Padmaja Bommareddy (SVP Corporate Development), Steph Warnery (VP People Solutions), Joyce Chen (VP Engineering), and Andrew Watts (SVP Product Management). The conversation focused on the progress we've made towards our Women in Leadership goal and how we can continue to drive gender balance and equity at every level of Zalando.

Key takeaways included the importance of gender equity, the power of asking for help, and the challenges (and triumphs) of navigating career development while building a family. It was a powerful reminder of the importance of support and collaboration. A massive thank you to Kay Muwoki (Central D&I team), the P&O team and the Zalando Women's Network for organising such an impactful event üß°

It's vital that we continue to amplify these conversations and drive positive change within our organisation and beyond. Thank you to all who participated and attended!

              Shopee is the leading e-commerce platform in Southeast Asia and Taiwan. It is a platform tailored for the region, providing customers with an easy, secure and fast online shopping experience through strong payment and logistical support.

Shopee, a Sea company, was first launched in Singapore in 2015, and has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Vietnam and the Philippines. Sea is a leader in digital entertainment, e-commerce and digital financial services across Greater Southeast Asia. Sea's mission is to better the lives of consumers and small businesses with technology, and is listed on the NYSE under the symbol SE.

              At Kroger, we believe no matter who you are or how you like to shop, everyone deserves affordable, easy-to-enjoy, fresh food. This idea is embodied in our simple tagline‚ÄîFresh for Everyone‚Ñ¢.  

Kroger ranks as one of the world‚Äôs largest retailers. We are nearly half a million associates across 2,800 stores in 35 states operating two dozen grocery retail brands and 34 manufacturing and 44 distribution locations, all dedicated to living our Purpose: to Feed the Human Spirit‚Ñ¢. Together, we serve more than 11 million customers daily in our stores and online through convenient e-commerce options like pickup, ship and delivery, serving America through food inspiration and uplift. 

Customers love Our Brands, including the popular Kroger¬Æ, Private Selection¬Æ and Simple Truth¬Æ brands. Our own manufacturing plants produce many of Our Brands products, including breads, dairy products, meat and thousands of grocery items.

#Kroger #FreshFoods #FreshForEveryone #NationalNutritionMonth #SeasonalFood #WeAreKroger","likes_count":145,"comments_count":5,"medias":["https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D5622AQFm8AeTvvWqKg/feedshare-shrink_2048_1536/B56ZWqgSefGsAo-/0/1742322346905?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=e2tkM_sdeOksNxGaL3ooxnet4XpHW_IxPgoVIYKdSMA"]},{"repost":true,"time":"1w","text":"When severe storms, including tornadoes, hit the Midwest last weekend, the team at our Central store in Rolla, Mo., immediately jumped into action.

              At Nordstrom, we empower our employees to set their sights high and blaze their own trails. This is a place where your success and growth are truly a result of your own efforts and achievements. 

Our teams are made up of motivated people who work hard to become leaders within the company, at all levels of the organization. These well-traveled paths show how hard work, loyalty, a competitive spirit and your unwavering commitment to the customer can take you and your career to new places.  

In addition to being a great place to have a career, we‚Äôre also committed to respecting the environment and supporting our communities. To learn more, check out NordstromCares.com.

At QVC we believe that our success is driven by the amazing individuals who bring their skills, dedication and passion to our team.

Today we shine our spotlight on Karo Czapracka, Talent Acquisition Coordinator in our Krakow offices. 

ùêìùêûùê•ùê• ùêÆùê¨ ùêöùêõùê®ùêÆùê≠ ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê´ùê®ùê•ùêû. 
As a Talent Acquisition Coordinator, I facilitate the interview scheduling within the Operations market. Working with various schedules keeps my work engaging and never allows me to feel bored! 

ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùê•ùê®ùêßùê† ùê°ùêöùêØùêû ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§ùêûùêù ùêüùê®ùê´ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêöùêßùê≤?
A year and a half!

ùêÖùêöùêØùê®ùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùêû ùêåùê®ùêØùê¢ùêû? 
Gladiator (2000).

              About UNIQLO LifeWear
Apparel that comes from the Japanese values of simplicity, quality, and longevity. Designed to be of the time and for the time, LifeWear is made with such modern elegance that it becomes the building blocks of each individual‚Äôs style. A perfect shirt that is always being made more perfect. The simplest design hiding the most thoughtful and modern details. The best in fit and fabric made to be affordable and accessible to all. LifeWear is clothing that is constantly being innovated, bringing more warmth, more lightness, better design, and better comfort to people‚Äôs lives.

About UNIQLO and Fast Retailing
UNIQLO is a brand of Fast Retailing Co., Ltd., a leading Japanese retail holding company with global headquarters in Tokyo, Japan. UNIQLO is the largest of eight brands in the Fast Retailing Group, the others being GU, Theory, PLST, Comptoir des Cotonniers, Princesse tam.tam, J Brand and Helmut Lang. With global sales of approximately 2.77 trillion yen for the 2023 fiscal year ending August 31, 2023 (US $18.92 billion, calculated in yen using the end of August 2023 rate of $1 = 146.2 yen), Fast Retailing is one of the world‚Äôs largest apparel retail companies, and UNIQLO is Japan‚Äôs leading specialty retailer. 

UNIQLO continues to open large-scale stores in some of the world's most important cities and locations, as part of its ongoing efforts to solidify its status as a global brand. Today the company has a total of more than 2,400 UNIQLO stores across the world, including Japan, Asia, Europe, and North America. The total number of stores across Fast Retailing's brands is now close to 3,600.

In Korea, UNIQLO has donated 50,000 HEATTECHs to the elderly who suffer from low income. The increase in the poverty ratio among the elderly, especially those who live alone, is becoming one of the serious social issues as Korea is turning into an aging society. 

UNIQLO Korea partnered with SCELA (Support Center for the Elderly Living Alone), one of the largest NGOs supporting the elderly, and donated 50,000 HEATECHs to 25,000 elderly living in January. 

UNIQLO also held a special event inviting 600 elderlies living alone at a local senior welfare center, and served Tteokguk, a Korean special meal for the Lunar New Year, to celebrate the completion of HEATTECH donation, sending our warm hearts to the elderlies before the Lunar New Year holidays.¬† 

We hope ‚ÄòThe Heart of LifeWear‚Äô will help make life better and more comfortable for people in need around the world.

#uniqlo #fastretailing #lifewear #powerofclothing #whatmakeslifebetter #internship #summerinternship #tokyointernship #undergraduates #globalcareeropportunity #businessleader","likes_count":639,"comments_count":9,"medias":["https://dms.licdn.com/playlist/vid/v2/D5605AQHlKlVNnHkbsA/mp4-720p-30fp-crf28/B56ZRzZpmaHsBs-/0/1737103134917?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=ZedYrljtMxoJJQuWjx29r-rY4EXo-36x0XRb0mSawzc"]},{"repost":false,"time":"2mo","text":"[UNIQLO In Indonesia Donates New Clothes to Railway Front Liner as Part of The Heart of LifeWear Global Initiative]

As part of the Heart of LifeWear global initiative to donate 1 million pieces of clothes worldwide, UNIQLO in Indonesia committed to donating 15,100 pieces of AIRism Innerwear products to local communities supporting vulnerable society members like children, women, workers, disaster victims, and refugees through several organizations. In this festive holiday season, one of the focus beneficiaries is the railway front-liners who are expected to keep delivering their best service to customers, as trains still become the most used transportation by Indonesian people during the end-of-year holiday. 

On December 16 2024, UNIQLO, Indonesia handed over 2,100 AIRism Innerwear products to Indonesia Railways State Owned (PT KAI). This symbolic event is kicking off a series of clothing donations by the company to community groups and organizations over the next months.
¬†
The donation of AIRism innerwear products will be distributed to PT KAI frontline workers across Java such as stewards, conductors, customer service, security, and cleaning service staff. We also warmly welcomed Maudy Ayunda, UNIQLO Brand Advocate, Indonesia who joined the talk show and symbolic handover with over 32 Indonesian media channels. Through the donation, we hope to not only enhance the comfort of railway frontline workers but also express appreciation for their dedication to delivering unforgettable experiences to Indonesian train passengers.

In celebration of the International Day of Disability, UNIQLO in Indonesia recently conducted the People with Disability (PWD) Gathering.  On December 12, 2024 - a total of 16 PWD staff and 5 volunteers participated in several training sessions to sharpen their leadership as to give the best service to customers.  The activities covered several aspects: Lead Yourself - Introduction of employment regulation; Lead Your Style - styling and grooming sharing by In-store Marketing Team of UNIQLO, Indonesia, and Lead Your Emotion - by practicing breathing, drawing, and motoric practices to manage emotions, which led by our partner, Roemah Bahagia. 

This event continued on the next day at Special School Need 12 South Jakarta where we conducted Circular Economy Education through upcycle and playful activities with ASA Foundation, an organization that focuses on educating children through sports. More than 80 disabled students, 15 teachers, and 25 UNIQLO volunteers engaged in crafting sports equipment using paper and plastic waste materials and competed in inclusive sports which taught them about teamwork and communication.

This is the first time all the PWD staff are being involved as volunteers in the external event, it would be a great experience for everyone.

              Trafigura is a leading commodities group, owned by its employees and founded over 30 years ago. At the heart of global supply, Trafigura connects vital resources to power and build the world. We deploy infrastructure, market expertise and our worldwide logistics network to move oil and petroleum products, metals and minerals, gas and power from where they are produced to where they are needed, forming strong relationships that make supply chains more efficient, secure and sustainable. We invest in renewable energy projects and technologies to facilitate the transition to a low-carbon economy, including through MorGen Energy and joint venture Nala Renewables.

The Trafigura Group also comprises industrial assets and operating businesses including multi-metals producer Nyrstar, fuel storage and distribution company Puma Energy, the Impala Terminals joint venture and Greenergy, supplier and distributor of transportation fuels and biofuels. The Group employs over 13,000 people, of which over 1,400 are shareholders and is active in over 150 countries. 

Visit: www.trafigura.com

Patrick was joined by:
Stine Grenaa Jensen (Energinet)
Anke Alvermann-Schuler (Gasunie Deutschland)
Gerrit Riemer (Thyssenkrupp Steel)

Organised by Green Power Denmark and Danish Industry, the forum highlighted the urgent need for stronger German-Danish collaboration. With Denmark as a leading producer of green hydrogen and Germany as a key offtaker, this partnership is one of Europe‚Äôs most promising opportunities for green hydrogen development.

Shifting market dynamics and evolving political landscapes are key to industrial competitiveness and European energy independence, presenting a strategic opportunity to accelerate green hydrogen adoption and meet 2030 decarbonisation targets.

The panel was moderated by Andreas Wenzel (German-Danish Chamber of Commerce).

‚ÄúWhat we are now seeing across global carbon markets are themes of clarity, convergence and competition.¬†
  
Clarity in the form of crystallised regulatory paths to the end of the decade, where companies now have line of sight on long term compliance requirements. Convergence in terms of specification for projects - specifically with the launch of the Article 6 market and also removals as seen with Symbiosis buyers‚Äô consortia. And finally, competition - where companies and countries alike are focused on competitive advantage as it relates to the need for CBAMs, demanding returns from sustainability investments, and ensuring long term advantage with low carbon intensity products.‚Äù

LDC and Global Clean Energy have renewed their camelina cultivation collaboration for a decade, building on a successful three-year pilot. 

With its low water requirements, short growing cycle and ability to improve soil health, camelina cultivation as an intermediate crop offers farmers a valuable addition to their crop rotations, helping to optimize land use while contributing to more sustainable, lower-carbon supply chains for high-protein animal feed and advanced biofuels.

Established in Argentina and Uruguay, our camelina program will expand into Paraguay in 2025, and we are grateful to local farmers in the region for embracing this opportunity to grow an ultra-low carbon feedstock, as a lever for meaningful progress on our common sustainability journey.

Learn more: https://lnkd.in/dR6hcbjZ

#SustainableAgriculture #RenewableFuels #SustainableFarming

    

Expansi√≥n del Cultivo Sustentable de Camelina en Sudam√©rica

LDC y Global Clean Energy han renovado su colaboraci√≥n para el cultivo de camelina por una d√©cada, tras un exitoso programa piloto de tres a√±os.

Con su baja necesidad de agua, ciclo de crecimiento corto y capacidad para mejorar la salud del suelo, el cultivo intermediario de camelina ofrece a los productores una valiosa incorporaci√≥n a sus rotaciones de cultivos, ayudando a optimizar el uso de la tierra mientras contribuye a cadenas de suministro m√°s sustentables y bajas en carbono para alimento animal de alta prote√≠na y biocombustibles avanzados.

Establecido en Argentina y Uruguay, nuestro programa de camelina se expandir√° a Paraguay en 2025, y estamos agradecidos con los agricultores locales de la regi√≥n por aprovechar esta oportunidad para cultivar una materia prima ultra-baja en carbono, para apalancar un progreso significativo en nuestro camino hacia la sustentabilidad.

              Olam Group is a leading food and agri-business supplying food, ingredients, feed and fibre to 20,900 customers worldwide. Through our purpose to ‚ÄòRe-imagine Global Agriculture and Food Systems‚Äô, Olam Group aims to address the many challenges involved in meeting the needs of a growing global population, while achieving positive impact for farming communities, our planet and all our stakeholders. 

Headquartered and listed in Singapore, Olam Group currently ranks among the top 30 largest primary listed companies in terms of market capitalisation on SGX-ST.

The FTSE4Good Index Series identifies companies that demonstrate strong Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) practices and is used by a variety of market participants to create and assess responsible investment funds.

This is 23% higher than the current US$3.25 billion market capitalisation of the entire Group, consisting of Olam Agri, ofi and the Remaining Olam Group.

At the completion of the above tranche, expected for Q4 2025, OGL will have a put option to sell its remaining 19.99% stake in Olam Agri to SALIC, exercisable on the third anniversary of completion.
 
Upon completion of both these tranches, Olam Agri will be a 100% owned subsidiary of SALIC. OGL continues to hold a 100% interest in ofi and the Remaining Olam Group. 

The Board will in time determine the use of the gross proceeds from the transaction, which may include debt repayment, right-sizing the capital structure of OGL and ofi, as well as a possible one-time special dividend distribution.
